metadata.title: CVE-2015-9253 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in PHP 7.3.x before 7.3.0alpha3, 7.2.x before7.2.8, and before 7.1.20. The php-fpm master process restarts a childprocess in an endless loop when using program execution functions (e.g.,passthru, exec, shell_exec, or system) with a non-blocking STDIN stream,causing this master process to consume 100% of the CPU, and consume diskspace with a large volume of error logs, as demonstrated by an attack by acustomer of a shared-hosting facility.

criterions.comment: php7.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
